div.head: Mold reheating
div.ab: After your molds have been reheated le & cleaned, casting soonest is best, because if you keep them, they get corrupted and damp. Reheat the thickest part, where the body of the animal is, at the top, so that, if there is something inside to burn, it falls to the bottom.
Mark the part on top to recognize it
It can only be good to let the mold die down a little from the outside so long as, being well reheated, so long as it remains red on the inside when you will cast.
